titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the S. Judson Crandell Papers circa 1950s-1966
titlestmt.author: Cheryl Gunselman

publicationstmt.publisher: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-01-28.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS 2nd Edition ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

did.abstract: S. Judson Crandell's lecture outlines and notes for teaching college speech and communication classes at Washington State University.

bioghist.p: S. Judson "Jud" Crandell (1913-1966) was a faculty member in the Department of Speech at Washington State University from 1946 until his death in 1966, and served as department chair from 1947 to 1963. He was an active scholar in the field of public speaking, co-authoring a textbook, Speech: A Course in Fundamentals (1963) and several articles in the Quarterly Journal of Speech and Western Speech. He earned his A.B. degree from Denison University (1934), his M.A. from the University of MIchigan (1937), and his Ph.D. from Northwestern University (1946).

acqinfo.p: Dr. Charles "Chick" Sandifer donated this collection to the Washington State University Libraries in 2017 (MS.2017.06).

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of S. Judson Crandell's lecture outlines and notes for teaching college speech and communication classes at Washington State University.

arrangement.p: The folders in this collection are arranged as they were when received by the repository. While there is no apparent overall organizational scheme, folders on closely related topics are grouped together.

processinfo.p: Cheryl Gunselman processed this collection in 2019.

prefercite.p: [Item Description]; S. Judson Crandell Papers; Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections; Washington State University Libraries; Pullman, WA.
